website_summaries.verdict: Small profile with just enough of an edge to cut through hard metals over time.
pros: We love the small stature of the tool, which makes it easy to fit in small spaces if necessary
Great to keep around in a pocket while on the job
cons: Lack of a handle will tire out most people after extended use

customer_reviews.title: Nice PEX Tubing Cutter
customer_reviews.text: I've been using SharkBite connectors for many years so when I decided to use PEX tubing for my new bathtub/shower installation I needed a PEX cutter. I didn't want to spend too much money because I probably won't need it again once the installation is complete. I usually use copper and soldered connections because of their durability but I wanted to see how PEX tubing worked out. I gave this cutter only four stars because you must pay close attention when cutting the PEX tubing or the cut won't be square. Without something to keep the tubing in place while cutting it's very difficult to get a good cut.
customer_reviews.author: Sichuan

customer_reviews.title: These do not cut nearly as easily as the ratcheting type that you can find
customer_reviews.text: These do not cut nearly as easily as the ratcheting type that you can find. To be fair, I bought them for 1 inch PEX which was probably a bad idea. I didn't use them on 1/2 or 3/4 but I am sure they would work. It takes a lot of wrist strength where the ratcheting type doesn't. No complaint about the seller, arrived on time and as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Laserguy

customer_reviews.title: This cutter is worthless
customer_reviews.text: Don’t waist your money on the tubing cutter. New right out of the package and it can’t cut 1/2” PEX tubing without flattening the tube. Really disappointed. I’m going to try and sharpen the blade but come on, I shouldn’t need to do this.
customer_reviews.author: M Johnson

customer_reviews.title: No longer sharp
customer_reviews.text: I've bought quite a few of these over the years, but this batch was horrible. I bought 3 and each one of them was SUPER dull. I mean, the ones I've been using for 5 months were sharper than these. The blades were actually blunt. Maybe they switched to some knock offs? Not buying again.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Huston

customer_reviews.title: Sharp and easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: I felt the need to review this product because when purchasing, some of the other reviews left me a little nervous -- some mentioned it cutting unevenly or on an angle but this was not the case at all. Perhaps those customers received a defective cutter, in which case, they should have contacted Amazon so that they could address it, but we did no have any issues with ours, even after many cuts. Cuts straight and perfect every time, very sharp making it very easy to use! Definitely keep out of reach of children though!
customer_reviews.author: Lauren C.

customer_reviews.title: Complete Junk - No Quality Control
customer_reviews.text: The SharkBite Cutter is the worst product I have ever purchased. It deserves a zero rating. The attached photo shows the blade condition when it came out of the bag. The blade edge was never honed or deburred and was almost completely covered with a burr from the machining process. It would dent the PEX, but that's all it would do. It's apparent there is zero quality control in the manufacturing process. I'm surprised SharkBite would put their name on this product. I have used other SharkBite products without a problem, but this makes me rethink using any of their products if they go through the same "quality control."
customer_reviews.author: SHR50

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: Quit making straight cuts after less than a dozen cuts making it far more difficult for the couple project I had. So if you are using this, plan on make several cuts to get one good cut Projects ( 3/4” PEX ): Installing water softener (new plumb, Tap in /w shut off) Projects ( 1/2" PEX) Kitchen: 2 new shutoff valves and Tee for Dishwasher. Bathroom: 2 new shutoff valves (new Vanity install)
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: Would not cut Pex after making a few (LESS than 10) cuts without crushing it
customer_reviews.text: Dulled to the point of crushing the Pex tubing after LESS than 10 cuts. Had to buy a different cutter. WOULD NOT recommend buying this product.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: Broke after (4) snips!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This product is junk. It takes an immense amount of pressure to cause it to cut, and when it does, it leaves a pinched line... I literally cut (4) cuts total and the blade broke in half on the fourth cut. Absolute waste of money. I ended up using a saws all. The shark bite connections are great. Very please with them. This, however, is better served as a door stop. Absolutely shocked.
customer_reviews.author: JBH

customer_reviews.title: useless tool
customer_reviews.text: Sharkbite charges a premium for their fittings, and they can because they are extremely high quality. Never had a problem with one. But, I'm surprised they would allow the SB logo on this tool. It's a clunker, barely cuts PEX, crushes it mostly. Have to twist the PEX to cut it, then not straight cuts. This is not a good tool for any price. Very dull blade. I will return it. Using a utility knife until a different product is delivered.
customer_reviews.author: Prof Rob

customer_reviews.title: Its junk pure junk Jerry
customer_reviews.text: Its junk. First one i got had nicks in the blade looking used already. Replacement looked alright. Used it today, can't cut cleanly or square. Crushes the pex to get through. Had to use a heat gun on all my cuts to get pex back to round. Maybe this isn't the right cutter for PEX-A expansion tube. Here's hoping that the tubing shrinks back and makes that seal albeit with non square cuts on the tube. My wife suggested an old school classroom paper cutter (the kind with the matchete handle) and I bet you that would have been way better if I could get one.
customer_reviews.author: The Other Dude

customer_reviews.title: Cutting Blade Bent First Time I Used It
customer_reviews.text: Not a durable product at all. On the first use, the blade bent to one side rending it useless. In fact, the cut was even diagonal instead of even as advertised. Not worth my time to return. I wouldn't recommend this product. Poorly made.
customer_reviews.author: J.E.P.

customer_reviews.title: Makes working with PEX easy
customer_reviews.text: I used this on a main feed line going into my tankless water heater. I was so afraid of cutting into the line, since if I goofed it up, I would be hosed and stuck with trying a hard fix or hiring a professional plumber and paying big dough. Needless to say, with this tool I was able to cut very cleanly, put on new fittings and had my water back up and running with no leaks within 5 minutes total.
customer_reviews.author: Tane

customer_reviews.title: Worked Great to cut 3/4" pex.
customer_reviews.text: This easily sliced off the old faucet head that was compression fit to my pex and not attached to the outside wall. I replaced it with a shark byte faucet, that after sliding on, attached to the wall with screws. Now I have a secure hose bib, attached to my wall, and it doesn't leak. Shark Byte rocks. I've also used SB to go from pex to copper to give me some backbone behind the shower head. Good company.
customer_reviews.author: BearTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Fast Cutting
customer_reviews.text: I finally broke down and purchased one of these after cutting tubing with a hand saw or table saw for years and I wish I would have purchased this sooner. This thing works fantastic and cuts through PEX like butter. Very easy to use. I haven't use anything larger the 1/2" yet but I'm sure it works just as well for larger sizes since it cuts the smaller sizes with ease.
customer_reviews.author: dusty

customer_reviews.title: Did the job
customer_reviews.text: I used these for half-inch pex pipe, my first time ever trying any plumbing repair. Replaced a deteriorating valve with a new ball valve. The repair went just fine, The cutter cuts easily through the pipe, but I like others had trouble cutting the pipe at a perfect perpendicular angle. I had to cut it two or three times before I was happy. Luckily there was a little excess pipe to play with. I still didn't get it exactly right, but the pex pipe is not leaking and so I've got very little to complain about.
customer_reviews.author: CDesign

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I went to brick and mortar store to buy this item. The sold pex pipes and pex connections but did not have the pex tube cutter. When I asked the floor supervisor about it he said Pex did not make a cutter, so I came home and ordered it through Amazon.Com. It was my first time to use a Pex product and I made a repair in my RV in a matter of a few minutes. I must admit, I was amazed with this product.
customer_reviews.author: KenR

customer_reviews.title: Not a quality cut
customer_reviews.text: So I have this item for over 5 months now and the cut quality is horrible If I could send them back I would. I thought it was me at first but after several folks using them I see that it is the cutter. Unlike the other cutters this cutter squeezes the pex before it cuts leaving the pex crimped where you cut the tube .
customer_reviews.author: greg snipes

customer_reviews.title: Not durable and poorly made
customer_reviews.text: First cut was great, but as the photo shows on second cut, the blade deflects easily to one side causing a less then high angle cut. I was cutting 3/4" Sharkbite brand PEX. This product is not of merchantable quality. I bought a descent Ridgid cutter instead. Utter garbage
customer_reviews.author: CFI William

customer_reviews.title: DON'T buy! Mashes your PEX does not cut

Opened the still new SharkBite PEX Cutting Tool package and tried to cut my 1/2" PEX pipe... It mashed the tube but did not cut at all. The cutting blade is so dull it can't cut the PEX pipe.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher V. Quick

customer_reviews.title: Thought shark bite was better?!
customer_reviews.text: My first thought was, “ wait is this thing broken?” But no, that’s how it was made. No spring in the grip handle. So after you cut it need to be pulled open. Not that it’s hard to do but in a tool of its type it’s what you would expect from a company like Shark Bite.
customer_reviews.author: J mullen

customer_reviews.title: Why waste your money? It isn't a real sharkbite tool.

The blade itself is flimsy and you can see the failed attempt to sharpen it at the factory. Well long story short..this "sharkbite" wanna be is definitely not the same company that makes the fittings amd the pex. This did NOT cut my 1/2" pex.
customer_reviews.author: Yooperguy

customer_reviews.title: Don't Cheap Out - Buy This Thing for PEX Jobs
customer_reviews.text: I recently installed the plumbing in the Tiny House I'm building, and this tool was indispensable. It gives this amazingly satisfying *click* during each cut, as it pops the PEX off of your larger roll. If you're doing a PEX job, just go ahead and buy this. Makes straight cuts a piece of cake.
customer_reviews.author: Casey Friday

customer_reviews.title: Sharkbite Plastic Cutting Tool
customer_reviews.text: Not every cut was ideal due to the handle & the blade, My guess is it's plastic so as you cut pipe the handle & blade move the blade moves just fine, but as you complete your cut the blade starts move into the bottom half of the tool. There is a precut slot in the plastic for the blade to travel to as it completes the cut that's not what the blade is doing. The Blade jams up on the other half of the tool.
customer_reviews.author: Dean

customer_reviews.title: EL Junko'

This thing is absolutely junk. Unusable. Will not even cut thin wall 3/4 pvc pipe. Don't let the sharkbite name fool you. Anyone who says this is good is most likely a novice and has never actually used a good tool before.

I finished the job with my 'ruined' original. With hundreds of cuts, even including some wire, the old cutters worked so much better. I returned the ones I bought here and I am thankful for Amazon's return policy.
customer_reviews.author: Seriously joking

The problem I had with this is the gap that the blade sits in is just a little to wide to allow the blade to cut in a straight line so some of the cuts were slightly angled which could be able problem when installing push fit connectors. It did do the job but could be better.

customer_reviews.title: Worked for small project

customer_reviews.title: If you're using PEX, do yourself a favor and get this!
customer_reviews.text: The first time I cut PEX I thought I could just use a razor blade and be done with it. WRONG! That PEX is strong stuff! So on to Amazon I went and this is what I came across. As difficult as PEX is to cut with a razor blade, it's ridiculously simple to cut with this! It's honestly as easy as cutting paper with a pair of scissors. Give a good clean cut everytime! I've found other material that is easy to cut using this as well, but as a PEX cutter, it's flawless!
customer_reviews.author: ahoffoss

customer_reviews.title: The right tool for the Pex cutting job
customer_reviews.text: As others have noted, just make sure you have the tubing as flat as possible around the cut to ensure that it remain perpendicular and squared off. Made about a dozen cuts one-handed, all of them came out great the first time

product_meta.title: SharkBite U701 PEX Cutting Tool, 1/4 inch-1 Inch Tube Cutter
product_meta.description:
Size:1 PackCUT. PUSH. DONE. Make a clean cut with PEX and PE-RT pipe. Lightweight, durable and easy to use. Compact design for working in tight spaces. Radial style: cuts 1/2 inch - 1 inch PEX and PE-RT pipe. Push the pipe into the cutting chamber and rotate the cutter in the direction of the arrow on the tool. Squeeze the handles to release the pipe after cutting. Scissor style: cuts 1/8 inch - 1 inch PEX and PE-RT pipe. Push the pipe into the cutting chamber and squeeze the handles to release the pipe after cutting. The SharkBite Connection System makes any plumbing project fast and easy thanks to unique push-to-connect technology. When you insert a pipe into a SharkBite quick-connect fitting, the fitting's stainless-steel teeth bite down and grip the pipe, while its special O-ring compresses to create a watertight seal.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Used to cut 1/4", 3/8", 1/2", 3/4" and 1" SharkBite PEX tubing.
